intro: Pentachaeta aurea subsp. aurea, commonly known as the golden pentachaeta, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces yellow to golden-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The subspecies aurea is distinguished by its bright coloration and compact growth habit.
